root_causes: The script computes an expected value using placeholder source variables (hPanelFlag, hSampleType) that are not defined in the expected logic and may not exist in the project.
The computed expected variable qList_chk is not scoped to production respondents (the compute runs unconditionally), while the comments state it should be limited to production.
The script adds special codes 97, 98, 99 to the allowed-codes check without confirmation these are the project's special-code values (may be correct, but needs verification).
instructions: Replace the placeholder variables (hPanelFlag, hSampleType) with the actual project-specific source variables used to determine List vs Off-List, or remove the qList_chk computation and mismatch check if no mapping is defined in the project specification.

Scope the qList_chk computation to production respondents only. Example options: (a) wrap the compute with IF IsInProductionMode() ... END IF., or (b) perform the compute inside a temporary selection that includes IsInProductionMode(), so qList_chk is only created for production cases.

Confirm the set of special codes to allow (97, 98, 99). If the project uses different special-code values, update the any(qList,...) check accordingly. If no special codes should be allowed, remove them from the allowed-code check.

If you choose to keep the qList_chk mismatch check, ensure the mapping logic (which values of the source variables imply qList=1 vs qList=2) exactly matches the project's expected mapping; otherwise remove the mismatch check to avoid false positives.
Retry with reduced context or smaller batch size
Retry with reduced context or smaller batch size

root_causes: Range/value check uses 1 as the allowed code but the expected valid answer code is 99.
instructions: Change the value check from ~range(B4dDKx3_99,1,1) to ~range(B4dDKx3_99,99,99) so the script validates the expected answer code 99.
Verify whether missingness should be considered an error for this item. If the item is optional, remove the miss(B4dDKx3_99) clause or only enforce range() when the item is not missing.

root_causes: The script treats missing responses for B4f_1 and B4f_2 as errors (miss(B4f_1) or miss(B4f_2)), but the expected logic does not indicate the items are required.
Range checks are applied unconditionally; they should be applied only when an item is present (to avoid flagging legitimate missing/skip responses).
instructions: Remove the unconditional missingness checks for B4f_1 and B4f_2 if the grid is not required. Replace miss(B4f_1) or miss(B4f_2) with conditional range checks such as (not(missing(B4f_1)) and ~range(B4f_1,0,10)) and (not(missing(B4f_2)) and ~range(B4f_2,0,10)).

Keep the cross-variable validation (B4f_2 < B4ba_1) but ensure it only runs when both B4f_2 and B4ba_1 are non-missing (e.g. (not(missing(B4f_2,B4ba_1)) and B4f_2 < B4ba_1)), which the script already does â€” just ensure the missingness logic above is corrected so missing values are not flagged erroneously.
